title.rendered: Forecast and Insights: The Path to a US$ 50.01 Billion Synthetic Leather Market by 2033

content.rendered:
The global synthetic leather market report provides a comprehensive analysis of the driving factors expected to boost the market’s value to US$ 50.01 billion by 2033. It highlights the increasing adoption of plant-based leathers and the rapid incorporation of synthetic leathers in various end-user industries as key growth drivers. The report provides crucial insights into the market’s forecast, competitive landscapes, challenges, regional analysis, and the role of emerging economies in driving sales.

NEWARK, Del, July 28, 2023 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) — As per Future Market Insight, the Global Synthetic Leather Market Size is anticipated to attain a value of US$ 50.01 billion by 2033, demonstrating a CAGR of 6%. This substantial growth marks a notable surge from its estimated worth of US$ 29.24 billion in 2023.

Eco-Friendly Appeal: Driving Demand for Synthetic Leather

Increasing awareness of environmental issues and the negative impact of animal leather production has led to a rise in demand for sustainable and cruelty-free alternatives. Synthetic leather, also known as faux leather, offers a more eco-friendly option. Artificial leather is typically more economical than authentic leather. This makes it an attractive choice for consumers seeking a similar look and feels without the higher price tag. Advances in material science and manufacturing technologies have led to the development of high-quality synthetic leather that closely mimics the appearance and texture of genuine leather. These innovations have expanded the synthetic leather market appeal.

Fashion and Footwear Industry: Key Drivers of Market Expansion

The fashion and apparel sectors are significant consumers of synthetic leather. The material is commonly used in the production of shoes, bags, clothing, and accessories, driving demand from fashion-conscious consumers. Increasing demand from the global footwear sector is anticipated to be a pivotal factor driving the overall market expansion. The exorbitant expense of organic leather is another element that has spurred the necessity for substitutes derived from natural materials. 

Download your Sample Report to stay ahead of the growth curve. Get key market details and stay informed about emerging trends! https://www.futuremarketinsights.com/reports/sample/rep-gb-4886

PVC Leather: Versatile and Cost-Effective Alternative

PVC leather is an additional crucial form of artificial leather that has surged in popularity owing to its wide range of applications, encompassing tote bags, beauty pouches, wallets, suitcases, handbags, and travel bags. It is utilized in diverse fields, including textiles, shoes, garments, upholstery, and others where a leather-like texture is desired. The substance is impracticable, inappropriate, and cost-prohibitive. The production procedure has progressed in recent years to incorporate a surface coating atop the synthetic polymer blend.

The Rise of Veganism: Fueling Demand for Animal-Free Alternatives

The surge in the vegan population is propelling the inclination towards faux leather due to its source of materials. Many corporations are now refraining from utilizing animal-derived sources in the production of leather. In general, artificial leather is created through either wet coagulation or dry coagulation processes, along with the transfer coating technique. Hence, the rise of veganism and ethical consumerism has prompted more people to choose animal-free alternatives, driving the demand for synthetic leather products.

Towards a Sustainable Future: Recycled Materials in Synthetic Leather

Synthetic leather proves to be more environmentally friendly than traditional or genuine leather. It can become even more eco-friendly and widely accepted by implementing certain modifications to its composition. Several companies are now prioritizing recycled materials for producing synthetic leather, aiming to promote sustainable development.

Companies are adopting the use of recycled polyester ultra-fine microfibers as the primary raw materials. This approach not only prevents microfiber pollution but also significantly reduces the demand for crude oil and petroleum-based products. Additionally, it helps in minimizing the level of carbon dioxide emissions associated with the processing and manufacture of virgin polyester fibers. Such discoveries play a crucial role in fostering the growth of the synthetic leather market.

Automotive Industry: A Significant End User of Synthetic Leather

The automotive industry is another key end-user of synthetic leather. The rapid population growth and disposable income have driven the demand for passenger and commercial vehicles. As a result, the automotive industry has experienced an increase in vehicle sales, along with continuous shifts in consumer preferences, particularly in terms of automotive interior aesthetics and designs. This has led to a surge in demand for premium-grade synthetic leather in recent years. It is extensively used in car interiors due to its durability, easy maintenance, and cost-effectiveness.

Key Takeaways from the Synthetic Leather Market

  • The synthetic leather industry in the United Kingdom is anticipated to rise sizably, exhibiting a CAGR of 5.9% through 2033, driven in part by the growing demand for eco-friendly and sustainable materials in the country’s fashion and consumer goods sectors.
  • In 2022, the United States Synthetic Leather Market accounted for a significant 12.1% share of the global synthetic leather industry, driven by its robust demand from key sectors such as automotive, fashion, and upholstery, along with its advanced manufacturing capabilities and strong distribution networks.
  • With a CAGR of 5.3% over the forecast period, India’s Synthetic Leather Market is predicted to develop rapidly in the market, primarily fueled by the country’s burgeoning fashion and automotive sectors’ increasing adoption of synthetic leather materials for their products.
  • In 2022, Japan’s Synthetic Leather Market held a 4.7% share of the global industry, driven in part by the country’s strong reputation for technological expertise and high-quality manufacturing processes in the synthetic leather sector.
  • The synthetic leather industry in China is expected to flourish speedily, registering a CAGR of 4.8% over the forecast period, primarily driven by the country’s massive population and increasing disposable incomes, leading to greater demand for synthetic leather products in various applications.
  • In 2022, Germany accounted for 7.4% of the global synthetic leather industry, bolstered by the country’s strong emphasis on sustainable manufacturing practices and its reputation for producing high-quality synthetic leather materials.

Competitive Landscape in the Synthetic Leather Market

Key players continuously invest in research and development to improve product quality and sustainability. Additionally, they are broadening their international footprint by engaging in strategic partnerships and acquisitions. The objective is to meet the rising demand for eco-friendly, cost-effective synthetic leather alternatives. These alternatives are sought in automotive, fashion, and furniture industries.

The Top Players are:

  1. Asahi Kasei
  2. Nan Ya Plastics Corporation
  3. Toray Industries
  4. Teijin Limited
  5. Kuraray Co., Ltd.
  6. Daewon Chemical Co Ltd.
  7. Kolon Industries Inc.
  8. Achilles Corp
  9. Mayur Uniquoters

Recent Developments by Key Players

In December 2021, Dow unveiled LUXSENSE Silicone Synthetic Leather, a pioneering high-end synthetic leather material. It establishes fresh benchmarks for transportation seating and interiors, furniture, fashion, wearable devices, and consumer electronics within the industry. This groundbreaking material represents a leap in material science, presenting an unparalleled alternative in the synthetic leather market.

In September 2021, Teijin Cordley Limited achieved a significant breakthrough by developing cutting-edge artificial leather with antiviral and antibacterial properties, incorporating a long-lasting antibacterial agent. Starting in October of the same year, Teijin Cordley commenced the sale of this latest antiviral synthetic leather.

  • Synthetic Leather for Bags
  • Synthetic Leather for Sports
  • Synthetic Leather for Electronics

  • Western Europe
  • Eastern Europe
  • Middle East & Africa
  • Japan

Geosynthetics Market Size: The global geosynthetics market Size is projected to grow year-on-year by 10.16%, reaching US$ 13.67 Billion in 2022, totaling US$ 26.89 Billion by 2029.

Synthetic Lubricants and Functional Fluids Market Trends: The synthetic lubricants and functional fluids market, which is currently valued at USD 7.90 billion in 2022, is expected to grow at a CAGR of 5.80% to reach USD 13.88 billion by 2032.

Synthetic Rubber Market Outlook: With a steady CAGR of 5.1% from 2023 to 2033, this market is expected to reach USD 45.74 Billion by 2023 and USD 75.22 Billion by 2033.

Phosphate Fertilizer Market Demand: Over the assessment period from 2023 to 2033, the global market is projected to expand at a compound annual growth rate (CAGR) of 5.1%, resulting in a market size of US$ 92,110.8 million by 2033.

Stainless Steel Market Growth: The market value of the stainless steel market is anticipated to reach a high of US$ 215.89 billion by the year 2033.

Wood Pellets Market Type: The wood pellets market is projected to be valued at US$ 10,037.6 million in 2023 and is expected to rise to US$ 24,345.6 billion by 2033.

Hydrofluoric Acid Market Analysis Forecast: The overall demand for hydrofluoric acid is projected to expand at a CAGR of 4.1% between 2023 and 2033.

Dolomite Market Sale: Future Market Insights (FMI) has forecast the Dolomite market value to surpass US$ 3,567.3 million in 2023.

Flame Proof Lighting Market Value: The overall sales of flame-proof lighting products are projected to grow at a robust CAGR of 9.5% between 2023 and 2033, totaling around US$ 1,292.4 million by the end of 2033.
